TopicTitle: LARGEST REUSABLE SSTO! The Kerbus Space 380. 1100 ton spaceplane.

Articles.Content:
Today I have entered a new level of Kerbalness.

After several unsuccessful prototypes, and many unfortunate and often spectacular deaths.... I have created what Werner Von Kerman previously thought was impossible. A 1000+ ton reusable spaceplane, successfully carrying 16 kerbals into orbit, and then landing in a field on the wrong side of the mountains near KSC. (I failed my astronavigation exams 13 times).

100% stock apart from a mechjeb module, no cheat menu. 1202 parts (-17 launch clamps), 1107 tons, 4815 atmospheric Delta V.. It doesn't have jets, it's powered by 4 mainsails and 36 aerospikes.

Crew capacity is 18. I thought I loaded it fully, so either I missed a couple of spots when loading, or there was some sort of sinister altercation during the flight, because only 16 guys came out after I landed it.

Vertical takeoff, and then horizontal landing. I did manage to launch an earlier prototype from the runway, but it exploded about 30 seconds into the flight, so I decided vertical was safer.

In the VAB. It was built in the SPH and then transferred across for the launch.

Launch

Flying Vertically

Orbit Achieved! With a tiny smidge of fuel left for the deorbit burn.

Descending for re-entry. The pink target is where KSC is, but I completely miss-timed the re-entry burn.

Warming up.

Holy-Mary-Mother-Of-God.

Yeah..... KSC is the other side of those mountains. The Kerbals prepare for a rough landing in what is now a 242 ton glider.

Final approach. Actually glides quite nicely, at around 45-50 m/s.

Touchdown!

Here are the crew. They look confused that they're actually still alive.

I will be honest...... it wasn't a 100% successful mission. A few wing parts did drop off when we landed, but that was down to pilot incompetence rather than the design of the plane. The real life shuttle was known to lose tiles from the bottom, and they never landed that in a field. With a bit of spacetape it'll be fine for another launch.

https://mega.co.nz/#!8wQ0GAJL!Ul3d7BN29oKOK9jQ1PBMbktQjXwnT8ylsSk6j8MAFPM

Craft file is here.

I accept no responsibility if it crashes your computer or falls apart on the launchpad (it's done both for me!). 1000+ part ships are rarely totally reliable. It takes off like a rocket with a regular gravity turn.

Make sure the time/deltav slider in the options is all the way to the right.

Action groups -

1. disables the vectoring on the mainsails. Turn off for launch, turn on again if you need more turning power..... but they have been known to rip the craft apart, so have them off for general flight.

2. Disables the mainsails. When you're well into the gravity turn and TWR doesn't matter, you can gain a little more DV by disabling these engines and just running on the aerospikes.

The original idea was to make something like a full sized Venture Star. That was supposed to be around 1000 tons, powered by loads of aerospikes.

I started off by sticking a bunch of fuel tanks, wheels and engines together, and then trying to get the whole mess to drive down the runway with rocket power, and then brake before I got to the end. Once it was able to do that without it falling apart, I knew the structure was strong enough to start adding wings and stuff too. To begin with it was going to have 6500 DV so it could do interplanetary flybys, but it lost quite a bit during the building.

I think I could scale it up somewhat. There's a sort of optical illusion in a lot of these photos that make it look like it's got a sort of ridge going along it's spine, but really it's completely flat, just 1 orange tank thick with girders and wing pieces on the bottom and the top. I guess the next level would be to try and create one that's two orange tanks thick.

I think the next one might be smaller, maybe 500-750 tons , but use the new rapier engines to see if it can get further than just LKO.

Well most of the spaceplanes we build in this game are very futuristic designs. This is much closer to real life spacecraft like the Shuttle or Buran, launching vertically and coming back as a glider. The "SSTO" part just indicates that nothing drops off, and it can all return back to solid ground for re-use.

I've been working on a larger version..... around 1800 tons, but with all-rocket SSTOs adding more DV is pretty difficult. When you add more fuel you have to add more engines to keep the TWR above 1, and you quickly reach a point where you add 100's of tons for barely any extra DV.

The next version should be able to do a flyby of the moon and minmus, but that's probably about it. Maybe Eve and Duna if it's possible to get a free return encounter. To maximise DV I think I've probably gotta go smaller and add atomic engines, but that'll come after the jumbo version I'm working on now.

The new patch should actually help a lot...... because with the tweakables I can drain the fuel tanks and see where the center of mass and lift are when it's coming back to land.
